5C22E7BBB56F46F58B8DC8E42072C4FC.description: Develop messages that use logical, emotional, and ethical appeals.

7E1327466D814B64BE3B539D555FB28B.description: Employ effective repetition, rhetorical questions, and delivery style to convey message to impact the audience.

A2B62B4B8D1A4EFBA70D3D6BBAFD41E1.description: Remain conscious of the audience and anticipate possible misconceptions  or objections.

6A846D3D141F42E7B9D139519958B045.description: Incorporate craft techniques to engage and impact audience and convey messages.

51BA73AAB5B04493A16930C0F9C7AA16.description: Analyze the speaker’s use of repetition, rhetorical questions, and delivery style to convey the message and impact the audience.

A909755502054F2CBDC1EB94ACD4EF08.description: Determine if the speaker develops well-organized messages that use logical, emotional, and ethical appeals.

5E84829BE3CF4687A5E20B5E8CEE9E21.description: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and  rhetoric, identifying any fallacies in reasoning or exaggerated or distorted  evidence.

99DABF6499CD499A88B8391AB1ED93D1.description: Critique how a speaker addresses content and uses craft  techniques that stylistically and structurally inform, engage, and impact  audience and convey messages.

680AE9FF933D48579F2DDF1F995015C7.description: Create visual and/or multimedia presentations, using a variety of media  forms to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence for diverse audiences.

AA719E45AC5643D7875921603AD49B39.description: Analyze how context influences the mode of communication used by the  presenter in a given situation.

C0326DC5732D4F90B2D614742A05CC51.description: Communicate information through strategic use of multiple  modalities and multimedia to enrich understanding when presenting  ideas and information.

F24FDD3F652749169653139D4E58B572.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using standard English  when indicated or appropriate.

760516191736483BB9B38BF131D0697C.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding  plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

8143FDDF701849C0937F9308C0539841.description: Distinguish between credible and non-credible sources of information.

74B368EAA47B4EE7B155C1CEB9E7150E.description: Present information and findings from multiple authoritative sources;  assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question,  citing supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically such that  listeners can follow the line of reasoning, and the organization,  development, substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience,  and task.

9B35325B6AAC47A5974EA632DE84EE73.description: Articulate ideas, claims, and perspectives in a logical  sequence using information, findings, and credible evidence from  sources.

02505FB41BEA47C79AAB65289D5112C9.description: Utilize various modes of communication to present a clear, unique  interpretation of diverse perspectives.

29B08A51D06C4733859C0DE3DCC5E007.description: Synthesize areas of agreement and disagreement including justification  for personal perspective; revise conclusions based on new evidence.

EEDF13EFEA02426D9B84405278D901F2.description: Engage in dialogue with peers and adults to explore meaning and  interaction of ideas, concepts, and elements of text, reflecting, constructing, and articulating new understandings.

8F86CF86551147C09947BBB92157334F.description: Develop, apply, and adjust reciprocal communication skills and  techniques with other students and adults.

AB64FCE0BC034828B95CC3251F83FBF6.description: Initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions  with diverse partners; build on the ideas of others and express own ideas  clearly and persuasively.

2B054F0809DE4D37AA245C293FDA3D8F.description: Gather information from print and multimedia sources to prepare for  discussions; draw on evidence that supports the topic, text, or issue being discussed; and develop logical interpretations of new findings.

5DC1943D9BD043759F137F8807ACC3EE.description: Interact with others to explore ideas and concepts,  communicate meaning, and develop logical interpretations through  collaborative conversations; build upon the ideas of others to clearly  express one’s own views while respecting diverse perspectives.

9A5F7D07063A4A738B2691F4A0B105B4.description: Write routinely and persevere in writing tasks over short and extended time frames, for a range of domain-specific tasks, and for a variety of purposes and audiences.

01D6DA9B1E014E0081171E0D68627880.description: Write independently, legibly, and routinely for a  variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences over short and extended  time frames.

8CA66F4673834E98ADD14F23BFFBA351.description: Commas to separate adjacent, parallel structures

9F6486EFA2494E9789BE86657D82B184.description: Colon to introduce a list or quotation

C2CC517EF6034D40A3B0E5BD6B4D85C2.description: Semicolon or a conjunctive adverb to link two or more closely  related independent clauses

F0DD4F44E3E54D0E9887DD9347D82ED4.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard  English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

E10D117C4EEB48E6850A1520E3CD071E.description: Use noun, verb, adjectival, adverbial, participial, prepositional, and  absolute phrases and independent, dependent, noun, relative, and  adverbial clauses to convey specific meanings and add variety and  interest to writing

C3845D4BAAC7470FA06D6FDCEA8FB325.description: Explain and use indicative, imperative, subjunctive, and conditional verb  moods to communicate different messages

7A615CF1697F4A68ADC083A224B5D128.description: Identify and use active and passive verbs

074E21A48C9545A5B9790B99F978A086.description: Identify and use gerunds, infinitives, and participles

BD5A30A317244ACABF0827E20E3A1405.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard  English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

B0864C6E0D1B48ECB17758CD9ED57B36.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is  experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative

0D4462F0F9FC42BAAE0BC4CDCE92197D.description: Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language  to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or  characters

41EE4405077748C2BD0E6279B64F30D3.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,  editing, rewriting

7AA0CEE2B5E7407CA50E7C3F50C991EC.description: Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on  one another to create a coherent whole

410B0DCA89CE446EA61E2D082D867D5B.description: Use narrative techniques of dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines to develop experiences, events, and/or  characters

ED25BA4D01BC43DEAFAD5D26BAC75611.description: Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or  observation, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and  introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression  of experiences or events

315BB6BC82A44D8B950B764F301400B5.description: Develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective  techniques, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences

066AF2C5251E42CFB315A5BB8E8237EC.description: Gather ideas from texts, multimedia, and personal experience to write  narratives that:

FC07FFD4CA5A4B5C97360F68DEAB2F59.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences  or events using effective techniques, well-chosen details, and well structured event sequences.

6436ACD03EB34C0EADBC65C6A456E83F.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and  supports the information or explanation presented.

C7693720D75249C5BDE292C0DE245612.description: Establish and maintain a consistent style and objective tone while  attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline

0F85F8A55DD54765840846CA2378DB8D.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the  complexity of the topic

7D8F5C71D7FC414FB2CE85C86B809AD3.description: Use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of  the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among  complex ideas and concepts

BA1068BE9A4C4F159AFDB381FD9E2A95.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,  editing, rewriting

415554411FC54ECABD8523FA009921FE.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while  avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation

F6BC9AAA065044C6A59BF0A01A8F4805.description: Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts,  extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other  information and examples appropriate to the audience’s knowledge  of the topic

E5C5BC7F579040138D58C1F2A4C4451F.description: Include formatting, graphics, and multimedia to aid comprehension  as needed

CC6F792D306E4F7681AB326A81D22B62.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source

599CD108D3B1484D9C13A143BF098682.description: Organize complex ideas, concepts, and information to make  connections and distinctions

8EC1CCCB65574D5899A0B88F63103894.description: Use relevant information from multiple print and multimedia sources

DF39FEB019C64CBBACE809BD8E4C732A.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey  complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

F9D09F3C2DD5435C9D79B9FA2BE10A14.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and  supports the argument presented

D32BF04F0B974A2AB7E52BAE92466E96.description: Avoid logical fallacies and demonstrate an understanding of  objectivity and subjectivity

9F1AA0ED96074B5E80AAE325D7114F2E.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while  avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation

258C07D3507F4186A5F66F2BEA263BEE.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,  editing, rewriting

CB86815E72BD4E3CA8214A9D745B257D.description: Develop the claim and counterclaims ethically without bias,  providing credible evidence and accurate interpretation of data for  each while delineating the strengths and limitations of the claim and  counterclaims

99AA6542F30547278ABA2BD24FA68D1C.description: Use an organizational structure that logically sequences and  establishes clear relationships among claims, counterclaims, reasons,  warrants, and evidence

99506DC22DFA45309F5A7F35BC6DD7FE.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source

0D53F6D04D6C41E7AB7A426616517E1F.description: Use relevant information from multiple print and multimedia sources

D5E607138807467EBA0F04FBF42E529F.description: Introduce a precise claim and differentiate between the claim and  counterclaims

C92BB2E3FCEE4079951ADCAD46998624.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and  relevant evidence.

EA99E07F75ED4171BA29E78F78AF3220.description: Read and respond to grade-level text to become self-directed, critical  readers and thinkers.

AD1064A3690D4E1C9214E29FF45AFB57.description: Read independently for a sustained period of time.

F843840DEB7947E6B0629A5E6814517B.description: Engage in whole and small group reading with purpose and  understanding.

A3BD66306F3F43CDA5E8C6FBCBCD5F55.description: Read independently and comprehend a variety of texts for  the purposes of reading for enjoyment, acquiring new learning, and  building stamina; reflect on and respond to increasingly complex text  over time.

C30F605ED59F4C22994F37C508AAB1B9.description: Analyze and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text,  assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and  sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning.

966C2B7FCE2347FC9483CAA0ABC4392D.description: Explain how the author’s ideas or claims are supported through the use  of text features and structures.

CE7BAF93001B4BBA8B140EF6B9F86017.description: Analyze and critique how the author uses structures in  print and multimedia texts to craft informational and argument writing.

2103553D10B849389A78213415CB23E0.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze  how an author uses rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose.

D0FC684A2F764C58A6F12F24F4D79D5B.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice  of purpose and perspective shapes content, meaning, and style.

9EC85321EC5C443DA62B8A74E25D1471.description: Use context clues to determine meanings of words and phrases.

537AA70F0C2A4EDF928A3030303A53DD.description: Apply a range of strategies to determine the meaning of  known, unknown, and multiple meaning words, phrases, and jargon;  acquire and use general academic and domain-specific vocabulary.

BC4DF66E310A4D959BDE0BAE7AA009AB.description: Determine how an author uses text features and structures to shape  meaning and tone.

79289F2955214688B71376EDAC78C0CB.description: Determine figurative, connotative, or technical meanings of words and  phrases; analyze the impact of specific words, phrases, analogies or  allusions on meaning and tone.

44BD795D50B24026BFE2404AE0B336B0.description: Interpret and analyze the author’s use of words, phrases,  text features, conventions, and structures, and how their relationships  shape meaning and tone in print and multimedia texts.

5AE02E7B84094144BB1DC8D4F5E0B486.description: Explain how the use of different mediums, modalities, or formats impacts the reader’s understanding of events, topics, concepts, and ideas in  argument or informative texts.

1311F27DD82445868D2CA3B003258A5F.description: Research events, topics, ideas, or concepts through multiple  media, formats, and in visual, auditory, and kinesthetic modalities

3A949DD2C6D54CA688E662DB5EB4DB85.description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the  course of the text including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by  specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

CC6DE1EEE2A24C8ABD92787E363DA423.description: Summarize key details and ideas to support analysis of  central ideas.

17ADB0695C6E4EB2A6D820A1257796A5.description: Cite significant textual evidence in order to articulate explicit meanings  and meanings that can be inferred from the text; identify multiple  supported interpretations.

BA7EA212E3DC4489AF3F303AC63476BF.description: Determine meaning and develop logical interpretations by  making predictions, inferring, drawing conclusions, analyzing,  synthesizing, providing evidence and investigating multiple  interpretations.

CA5CD707F44B4DB1A922053CBDBC4016.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support  comprehension.

03A9BE9818784149A61E35C025501C6E.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis  skills in decoding words.

B956B9E096E349F58A94487F59EB0BAF.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and  sounds.

24D615D1A9F44D879A8CFD6FFB2E6638.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic  features of print.

E848B25E43B54B0BA5E6D7CA2D54A4C1.description: Read and respond to grade level text to become self-directed, critical  readers and thinkers.

8AC7C7F1333A469096A5B8D142D73368.description: Read independently for sustained periods of time to build stamina.

83176336A17E4AAEBFDEC5431DEF8789.description: Engage in whole and small group reading with purpose and  understanding.

F9AFAE107B4C471E91F58DB96BF8FB7F.description: Read independently and comprehend a variety of texts for  the purposes of reading for enjoyment, acquiring new learning, and  building stamina; reflect on and respond to increasingly complex text  over time.

2BD16A5BF07E4DF7AEE30ADBB94E8962.description: Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure a text,  order events within the text, and manipulate time create different  effects.

4917DC79E3C740DA970975E4C98EE7D2.description: Determine the significance of the author’s use of text structure and plot organization to create the effects of mystery, tension, or surprise citing  support from the text.

5997197518A349D9908B2455870894CC.description: Analyze and critique how the author uses structures in  print and multimedia texts to shape meaning and impact the reader.

120DEFDC147A40C88BE4EB2E0430E88E.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice of point of  view, perspective, and purpose shape content, meaning, and style.

2F990525DD5A4F10BE5678E8E90FE37D.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice  of point of view, perspective, and purpose shape content, meaning, and  style.

EECBA0AFBB64414F86E228DDF049CD6C.description: Use context clues to determine meanings of words and phrases.

F222A3AAA15049A4B46844E95759933F.description: Apply a range of strategies to determine and deepen the  meaning of known, unknown, and multiple-meaning words, phrases, and jargon; acquire and use general academic and domain-specific  vocabulary.

72A022D8D1BE4F049DC4F337B3E20158.description: Determine the figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases;  analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone.

8D041DF1DFD64BFEBE43CC7DF7AE4F8D.description: Interpret and analyze the author’s use of words, phrases,  and conventions, and how their relationships shape meaning and tone in print and multimedia texts.

E2BE39C82A9E4AFABDD6CFCDCF0B47CA.description: Analyze how characters or a series of ideas or events is introduced,  connected, and developed within a particular context.

4C5E02C3908142C7815D3645DC339C28.description: Analyze characters, settings, events, and ideas as they  develop and interact within a particular context.

863A40F3BBD244F49FD0EF283A4CBFCD.description: Investigate how literary texts and related media allude to themes and  archetypes from historical and cultural traditions.

D36EB8B252C84471823F7F32DDF23A63.description: Trace the development of a common theme in two different artistic mediums.

A50D2F346B64429C992C56FEEB41CC3B.description: Analyze the relationship among ideas, themes, or topics in  multiple media, formats, and in visual, auditory, and kinesthetic  modalities.

70DDE472F22840088A630E430918D7BE.description: Determine a theme of a text and analyze its development over the course  of the text including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by  specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

B87823239BB4481D8634CF537BBC3BE6.description: Summarize key details and ideas to support analysis of  thematic development.

84602112F178484A942FADFE368DBCC2.description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the  text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text; identify  multiple supported interpretations.

3A1B4EEDCD8647FCA2BC8F100F76B512.description: Determine meaning and develop logical interpretations by  making predictions, inferring, drawing conclusions, analyzing,  synthesizing, providing evidence, and investigating multiple  interpretations.

491F57A9ACDC41FA8F54131F224BC628.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support  comprehension.

D708D57A193447D18438A7874515CCCB.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis  skills in decoding words.

E107DE2816DF4E79835BC1E949F47471.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and  sounds.

B4E9721CC6AC46D1A968D88CACF6F148.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic  features of print.

C435A1524E5D465B88DD7BA504D14F9C.description: Analyze the process to evaluate and revise plan and strategies; address  successes and misconceptions; and apply learning to future inquiry.

3C2E59A3DBF3460A9E8A2E0A69045C88.description: Analyze and evaluate previous assumptions; test claims; predict  outcomes; and justify results to guide future action.

C0806FB5E6944FC78AA671CFB6DB99DE.description: Acknowledge and consider individual and collective thinking; use  feedback to guide the inquiry process.

64FA234F91D945738BF0FEA9198D6079.description: Reflect throughout the inquiry process to assess  metacognition, broaden understanding, and guide actions, both  individually and collaboratively.

AB9EC4C5F2DB43D0B7716DA2E89DDADE.description: Determine appropriate disciplinary tools to communicate findings and/or  take informed action.

BBFD66712F7B409F8E0C7D7E2448BF43.description: Evaluate findings; address conflicting information; identify  misconceptions; and revise.

88C3968D32E24FBB9E78AC39AC5C8279.description: Employ a critical stance to analyze relationships and patterns of evidence  to confirm conclusions.

ABCCB31BEFAA465ABC61F76D2B5D94B6.description: Synthesize information to share learning and/or take action.

DC966A43D7D24A95BC7552EF6B87E24C.description: Organize and categorize important information; synthesize relevant ideas  to build a deeper understanding; communicate new learning; identify  implications for future inquiry.

7D984F5849ED4C4FA875AC6757307369.description: Gather information from a variety of primary and secondary sources and  evaluate for perspective, validity, and bias.

988D94A2E0AC4783BE1D5E6868A74EEE.description: Examine historical, social, cultural, or political context to broaden  inquiry and create questions.

582C2995CACC47578B63683B64F678D0.description: Develop a plan of action by using appropriate discipline specific  strategies.

CD7CE300D94F42EAA320621032BAA5FA.description: Construct knowledge, applying disciplinary concepts and  tools, to build deeper understanding of the world through exploration,  collaboration, and analysis.

AE40936EF9BA43E49C4A24BE9F2605E2.description: Analyze ideas and information from text and multimedia by formulating questions, proposing interpretations and explanations, and considering  alternative views and multiple perspectives.

3C29177D49714BFAA8DF4DA74A20CCC7.description: Transact with texts to formulate questions, propose  explanations, and consider alternative views and multiple perspectives.

EA46A4486B7C48FDA62F5AF74B7F6C9D.description: Use a recursive process to develop, evaluate, and refine, questions to  broaden thinking on a specific idea that directs inquiry for new learning  and deeper understanding.

AD413FAE81D64AA183C784CF36325F27.description: Formulate relevant, self-generated questions based on  interests and/or needs that can be investigated.
